postcontent:
I bought this rifle a couple of days ago to help out a young man where I work. I really like it, but have absolutely no use for it since I have plenty of hunting rifles. This one was made in 1967. Has the rolled-in basket weave stock. Other than doing this instead of checkering, Winchester didn't cheapen it up after 1964. The rifle's internals looked about new when I disassembled it. Bore is perfect and there has never been any rust on it anywhere. It still has its original front sight hood. This is a lot less common than the .308 version of the Model 100.

 Here are the negatives: There are a small amount of scratches on the left side of the stock above the trigger guard. The stock is oil finished so they look pretty good, but can be cleaned up. There are a couple of hairline scratches in top of the barrel near the front sight. Hard to see, but I tried to photograph them. 

 Now for the positives. I completely disassembled the rifle to clean it and to check if the firing pin recall has been done. It still has its original firing pin. If you want to replace it, Winchester/Olin is still honoring their recall, and will send you an updated pin plus a check for $30 if you send them the original. The stock is solid with no cracks and it still has its original butt plate in place. These don't need a recoil pad, especially in .243, since they are a "soft shooting" gas operated semi. Most I have seen have an aftermarket pad. Lol, it feels about like a Ruger 10/22 in the hand. I think it's an attractive, lightweight hunting rifle.

 Other than what was noted above, the metal is in terrific shape, and would rate at least 95%. The trigger is particularly nice in comparison to others I have owned in the past. it should make a fine hunting rifle, especially for a youngster or a lady hunter. It already has a one piece scope base installed, so it will be easy to mount a scope. I have a spare never-mounted Leupold 3-9 Rifleman scope you can have for an extra $125 that I can include if you want it. I haven't bought rings for it in case you want to choose your own scope height or see-through rings.
